### Helping People Take Action With Their Money - A New Kind of Coaching Arrives in Japan
Published on 2025-04-01
![](https://www.habitto.com/blogs/money-mojo/)![](https://www.habitto.com/blogs/money-mojo/)![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/60186/1743499581-money-mojo.jpeg?auto=format)
At Habitto, weâ€™ve always believed that helping people feel better about money goes beyond great products.
In 2024, we teamed up with [_**Money Mojo**_](https://www.linkedin.com/company/money-mojo/?viewAsMember=true), a global financial coaching consultancy, to co-create Japanâ€™s first **money behavioural coaching program**.
Our goal? Help people build the confidence to make smart financial decisions - not just know what to do, but actually _do_ it.
ğŸš€ **What We Built Together** : Led by behavioural finance coach [_Sanam Balani_](https://www.linkedin.com/in/sanambalani/), Money Mojo worked closely with our team to:
  * Design a step-by-step coaching system, tailored to Japanese users
  * Train our in-house advisors in new coaching and behavioural skills
  * Deliver practical support that helped users change their habits


ğŸ“ˆ **The Pilot Results Were Powerful**
  * **334%** increase in monthly app opens
  * **318%** increase in chat and video engagement
  * **100%** of users felt more **confident making financial decisions**
  * **100%** rated the experience **5/5 for value and relevance**
  * Advisors scored **4.75/5 for delivery**


ğŸ§­ **Why It Matters** This isnâ€™t just a new product. Itâ€™s a new way forward. Blending human coaching, fintech, and behavioural insight can create deeper, more lasting change in how people manage money.
ğŸ‘ Big thanks to Sanam and the Money Mojo team for leading this engagement from strategy to delivery.
ğŸ“– [See the full case study](https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/habitto-experiment-how-financial-coaching-led-record-engagement-fzxsf) by Money Mojo for more insights.
* * *
### **About Money Mojo**
[_**Money Mojo**_](https://www.linkedin.com/company/money-mojo/?viewAsMember=true) is a boutique financial wellbeing consultancy helping people gain confidence and take action with their money. Founded by [_**Sanam Balani**_](https://www.linkedin.com/in/sanambalani/), a former Goldman Sachs executive, the firm partners with innovative financial institutions globally to create behavioural coaching programs that build trust and engagement with clients. Sanam brings deep banking expertise across JAPAC and EMEA, with a modern coaching lens focused on behaviour change.
ğŸ”—[ _Connect with Sanam Balani on LinkedIn_](https://www.linkedin.com/in/sanambalani/)
ğŸ”—[ _Book a Consultation with Money Mojo_](https://calendly.com/moneymojo/discovery)

**Scrum Venturesã«ã¤ã„ã¦**
ã‚¹ã‚¯ãƒ©ãƒ ãƒ™ãƒ³ãƒãƒ£ãƒ¼ã‚ºã¯ã€ã‚·ãƒªã‚³ãƒ³ãƒãƒ¬ãƒ¼ã¨æ±äº¬ã‚’æ‹ ç‚¹ã¨ã—ã€ã‚¢ãƒ¼ãƒªãƒ¼ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒ¼ã‚¸ã®ã‚¹ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒˆã‚¢ãƒƒãƒ—æŠ•è³‡ã¨ã€æ—¥æœ¬ä¼æ¥­ã¨ã‚°ãƒ­ãƒ¼ãƒãƒ«ã‚¹ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒˆã‚¢ãƒƒãƒ—ã®æ–°è¦äº‹æ¥­å‰µå‡ºã‚’è¡Œã£ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚ã‚ªãƒ¼ãƒ—ãƒ³ã‚¤ãƒãƒ™ãƒ¼ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ã®æ‰‹æ³•ã‚’æ´»ç”¨ã—ã€å„æ¥­ç•Œã‚’ä»£è¡¨ã™ã‚‹ãƒ‘ãƒ¼ãƒˆãƒŠãƒ¼ã¨ã‚¹ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒˆã‚¢ãƒƒãƒ—ã¨ã®å…±å‰µã‚’æ”¯æ´ã™ã‚‹ã€Œäº‹æ¥­å…±å‰µãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚°ãƒ©ãƒ ã€ã®é‹å–¶ã‚„ã€æµ·å¤–ã‚¹ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒˆã‚¢ãƒƒãƒ—ã®æ—¥æœ¬é€²å‡ºç­‰ã‚’æ”¯æ´ã—ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚
  

**TOKYO â€“ 27th November 2024 â€“**[ _**Habitto**_](https://www.habitto.com/)**, the Japan-based digital bank looking to end financial anxiety for younger Japanese people, has raised US$11.7 million (JPY1.8 billion) via its Series A financing round.**  
  
The digital bank, offering a connected financial experience and free financial advice, via its mobile app, has attracted leading venture firms QED Investors, DG Daiwa Ventures (DGDV) and Scrum Ventures. This marks QED Investors first investment in Japan, following several high-profile investments in similar B2C fintechs, including Nubank in Brazil, Klarna in Sweden and Jupiter in India. Habittoâ€™s Series A round also saw returning investors Anthemis Group and other existing shareholders. 
The Series A funding will enable Habitto to accelerate its mission of reducing financial anxiety among Japan's younger generations, who often face economic uncertainties and lack access to appropriate financial advice. With a rapidly growing user base of over 42,000 installs Habitto's mobile app offers a comprehensive, free financial planning service supported by digital advisors providing personalised guidance to help users build effective financial strategies.
Key highlights of the funding round include:
  * An equity financing round of US$11.7 million (JPY1.8 billion)
  * Funds will be used to expand Habitto's user base under attractive unit economics, enhance its digital banking platform, and develop advanced financial tools and services tailored to the unique needs of young Japanese consumers.


Samantha Ghiotti, Co-founder & CEO, said, â€œWeâ€™re fortunate to have the support of a globally experienced investor like QED, paired with the local expertise of DGDV. Itâ€™s certainly a challenging funding environment, but in these two investors, weâ€™ve found partners with deep experience and knowledge in fintech. Habitto saw strong interest in the Japanese market from global investors throughout this round and we're excited for those making their way into the market for the first time.â€
In September 2021, Habitto initially raised a US$3.4 million seed round led by Saison Capital followed by a US$3.9 million pre-A financing round in February 2023, co-led by Saison Capital and Cherubic Ventures. With the recent completion of this US$11.7 million Series A round, Habittoâ€™s total capital raised now stands at US$19 million.
â€œWith this financing and backing of these investors, we will continue to tackle financial anxiety by helping Japanâ€™s younger generation develop money strategies. In just three years since our launch Habitto has been entrusted with more than JPY4.7 billion in deposits from customers looking to build a money strategy and better money habitsâ€ said Liam McCance, Co-founder & Chief Creative Officer.
â€œWe are enthusiastic about partnering with Habitto. Japan's fintech market is primed for innovation, with recent economic shifts drawing investor attention. Sam and Liam and the experienced team at Habitto have shown early success, securing key partnerships and licenses and are well set to build a compelling proposition for the market. This is our first investment in Japan and we are thrilled to be a part of the community,â€ commented Sandeep Patil, Partner & Head of Asia at QED Investors.
"We have been partnering with Habitto since 2021 and have been consistently impressed by the remarkable progress and performance under Sam and Liam's leadership. For this Series A round we are excited to co-lead alongside QED, a globally renowned fintech VC. With the involvement of a globally renowned firm in their Series A round, we not only reaffirm our strong belief in Habittoâ€™s massive potential but also in its ability to create a positive impact on Japan's fintech ecosystem" commented Yamato Watanabe, Managing Director at DG Daiwa Ventures, who is co-leading this round.
â€œWe are happy to support Sam, Liam and the whole team at Habitto againâ€, said Sean Park, co-founder of Anthemis Group, who will be joining the board as an observer as part of the round. â€œHaving been a part of the companyâ€™s journey from the very start, we are confident in the teamâ€™s ability to execute in this largely untapped market. Anthemis believes authentic collaboration is the key to success in finance, and the product experience Habitto has been able to create is a shining example of that.â€
**About Habitto Co., Ltd.**
Habitto Co., Ltd. is the operator of â€œHabittoâ€, a digital bank that provides free financial advice via mobile application. The Habitto app offers a combination of financial services including a market-leading yield savings account, debit card, insurance and investment products which are complemented with a tech-delivered human advisory service.
The company was born in Singapore when Samantha Ghiotti, an Italian woman turned venture investor turned fintech executive and Liam McCance, an entrepreneur from Australia, worked together in a Singaporean fintech company. The duo then founded SJ Mobile Labs Pte Ltd in Singapore in 2021 and established SJ Mobile Labs Japan KK (SJML Japan) in November of the same year to conduct business in Japan. The company officially changed its name to Habitto Co., Ltd. in March 2023.
**About QED Investors**
QED Investors is a global leading venture capital firm based in Alexandria, VA. Founded by Nigel Morris and Frank Rotman in 2007, QED Investors is focused on investing in disruptive financial services companies worldwide. QED Investors is dedicated to building great businesses and uses a unique, hands-on approach that leverages its partnersâ€™ decades of entrepreneurial and operational experience, helping companies achieve breakthrough growth. Notable investments include AvidXchange, Betterfly, Bitso, Caribou, ClearScore, Creditas, Credit Karma, Current, Flywire, Kavak, Klarna, Konfio, Loft, Mission Lane, Nubank, QuintoAndar, Remitly, SoFi, Wagestream and Wayflyer.
**About DG Daiwa Ventures**
DG Daiwa Ventures (DGDV) is a Tokyo-based venture capital firm that specialises in seed and early-stage investments, with a strong emphasis on global innovation. While headquartered in Japan, the firm maintains a diverse portfolio, with half of its investments in international companies. DGDV is dedicated to fostering cutting-edge technologies, while actively expanding into emerging fields such as deep tech, fintech and climate tech. The firmâ€™s mission is to drive transformative change across industries by bridging the gap between Japan and the world and by investing in startups that are pushing the boundaries of innovation.
**About Anthemis Group**
Anthemis Group cultivates change in the financial system by investing in, growing and sustaining businesses committed to resiliency, transparency, access and equity. Founded on three guiding principles - authentic collaboration, virtuous cycle outcomes and diversity and inclusivity - their deep understanding of markets and models, passion for emerging technology and values inspire everything they do. By creating fertile ground for a diverse group of startups, investors, entrepreneurs, institutions, academics, and visionaries to converge, they can solve the financial system's most pressing challenges faster, better and for the benefit of all.
**About Scrum Ventures**
Scrum Ventures, with offices in San Francisco and Tokyo, is committed to investing in industry-changing startups. Our team brings entrepreneurial experience and deep networks in both Silicon Valley and Asia, actively supporting founders throughout their journeys. Through Scrum Studio, we accelerate the growth of our portfolio companies by facilitating access to the Japanese market and fostering partnerships with iconic corporations.

Habittoã¯ä»Šå¾Œã‚‚è‹¥ã„ä¸–ä»£ã®ãŠé‡‘ã®ä¸å®‰ã‚’ãªãã™ã¹ãã€ãƒ—ãƒ­ãƒ€ã‚¯ãƒˆã‚„ã‚µãƒ¼ãƒ“ã‚¹é–‹ç™ºã«é‚é€²ã—ã¦ã„ãã¾ã™ã€‚  
  
  
ãƒ—ãƒ¬ã‚¹ãƒªãƒªãƒ¼ã‚¹ã¯ã“ã¡ã‚‰ã§ã™ğŸ‘‡  
<https://prtimes.jp/main/html/rd/p/000000028.000093571.html>
  

Habitto, driven by its purpose of "End Financial Anxiety," supports Japan's younger generations in developing asset-building strategies and cultivating good financial habits. Habitto carefully selects from the countless financial products available, making them simple and easy to understand, while providing personalized advice.  
  

We are pleased to announce that Habitto and GMO Aozora Net Bank have entered into a business partnership agreement to display Habitto's advertisements on GMO Aozora Net Bank's website. From August 21, 2024, a special page on the Habitto website will be displayed, allowing users to seamlessly open a Habitto account (GMO Aozora Net Bank Habitto branch) via the advertisement banners posted on GMO Aozora Net Bank's website. This strengthened partnership aims to help more customers discover and utilize Habitto's unique high-interest rates and services that support comprehensive asset-building plans, offering a broader perspective beyond simple savings accounts.  
  

**About Habitto's Offerings**
Habitto targets the younger generation*1, providing a one-stop solution on its app for financial products from trusted domestic partners and personalized advice from dedicated advisors tailored to each user's situation. Utilizing the advisory service is entirely optional, and there is no hard sell of financial products.
  * Savings Account "GMO Aozora Net Bank Habitto Branch" with a BaaS partnership with GMO Aozora Net Bank, offering a domestic top-tier interest rate of 0.3% (up to 1 million JPY, pre-tax)*2
  * A curated selection of investment trusts and insurance products from partner firms*3
  * Personalized asset-building advice from certified financial planners (FPs)


*1 Habitto's services are targeted at individuals aged 18 to 54.  
*2 According to a Habitto survey on July 17, 2024. Note that from October 1, 2024, the interest rate will be 0.4% (up to 1 million JPY, pre-tax).  
*3 Investment products are provided in partnership with Saison Asset Management, and insurance products in partnership with Lifenet Insurance.  
  

**A Long-Term Asset-Building Strategy for Those Who Have Awakened to Interest Rates**
Japan has experienced a prolonged period of near-zero interest rates, causing many in the younger generation to forget the concept of interest rates. In this context, customers interested in GMO Aozora Net Bank's ordinary savings accounts are smart individuals who recognize the advantages of online banking, such as convenience and low costs. Habitto aims to make these individuals aware of the growing importance of rising interest rates and encourages them to make their money work for them, even in a no-risk ordinary savings account. The three steps of asset-building are "Save," "Grow," and "Prepare for Risks." This strengthened partnership presents an excellent opportunity to introduce Habitto's services to customers who have already begun, or are about to begin, the first step of "saving" and help them move on to the next step, adopting a more comprehensive asset-building plan that offers a broader life perspective.  
  

**Comment from CEO Sam Ghiotti on Strengthening the Partnership**
Regarding the enhanced partnership, CEO Sam Ghiotti commented:
"When launching Habitto, we chose GMO Aozora Net Bank, which we felt was the best BaaS provider in the country, as the ideal partner for our dynamic business. We are delighted to further deepen our relationship with Chairman Kaneko and his team, who have supported Habitto since our partnership began, and to be able to offer Habitto's products within the GMO Aozora Net Bank ecosystem."  
  

Habitto will continue to focus on product and service development to alleviate financial anxiety among the younger generations.

### Habitto Launches "Death Meter" Tool to Help People Understand Their Mortality Risk
Published on 2024-06-07
![](https://www.habitto.com/blogs/deathmeter-announcement/)![](https://www.habitto.com/blogs/deathmeter-announcement/)![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/60186/1717998164-deathmeter_habitto.jpg?auto=format)

**Habittoã«ã¤ã„ã¦**
Habittoã¯ã€ã€ŒEnd Financial Anxiety | ãŠé‡‘ã®ä¸å®‰ã‚’ãªãã™ã€ã¨ã„ã†ãƒ‘ãƒ¼ãƒ‘ã‚¹ã®ã‚‚ã¨ã€è²¯è“„ã€æŠ•è³‡ã€ä¿é™ºã€ãã—ã¦ã‚¢ãƒ‰ãƒã‚¤ã‚¹ã®å…¨ã¦ã‚’æä¾›ã™ã‚‹ã€Œã‚¢ãƒ‰ãƒã‚¤ã‚¹ã™ã‚‹ãƒ‡ã‚¸ã‚¿ãƒ«ãƒãƒ³ã‚¯ã€ã§ã™ã€‚å›½å†…æœ€é«˜æ°´æº–ã®é é‡‘é‡‘åˆ©ã€ãƒ‡ãƒ“ãƒƒãƒˆãƒ»ã‚­ãƒ£ãƒƒã‚·ãƒ¥ãƒãƒƒã‚¯ã€ç„¡æ–™ã§ãƒ‘ãƒ¼ã‚½ãƒŠãƒ«ãªã‚¢ãƒ‰ãƒã‚¤ã‚¹ã§è‹¥ã„ä¸–ä»£ã®ãƒãƒãƒ¼æˆ¦ç•¥ã‚’ã‚µãƒãƒ¼ãƒˆã—ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚
Habittoã¯ã€ãƒ™ãƒ³ãƒãƒ£ãƒ¼æŠ•è³‡å®¶ã‹ã‚‰ãƒ•ã‚£ãƒ³ãƒ†ãƒƒã‚¯çµŒå–¶è€…ã¸è»¢èº«ã—ãŸã‚¤ã‚¿ãƒªã‚¢äººå¥³æ€§ã®ã‚µãƒãƒ³ã‚µãƒ»ã‚®ã‚ªãƒƒãƒ†ã‚£ã¨ã€ã‚ªãƒ¼ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ©ãƒªã‚¢å‡ºèº«ã®é€£ç¶šèµ·æ¥­å®¶ãƒªã‚¢ãƒ ãƒ»ãƒã‚«ãƒ³ã‚¹ã«ã‚ˆã£ã¦ç«‹ã¡ä¸Šã’ã‚‰ã‚Œã¾ã—ãŸã€‚2021å¹´11æœˆã«ã‚¨ã‚¹ã‚¸ã‚§ã‚¤ãƒ»ãƒ¢ãƒã‚¤ãƒ«ãƒ©ãƒœã‚¸ãƒ£ãƒ‘ãƒ³æ ªå¼ä¼šç¤¾ã¨ã—ã¦ã‚¹ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒˆã—ã€2023å¹´3æœˆã€ç¤¾åã‚’æ ªå¼ä¼šç¤¾Habittoã«å¤‰æ›´ã—ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚
  

**Tokyo, Japan â€“ June 7, 2024** â€“ Habitto, a digital bank that provides savings, investment, insurance, and advice, has launched the "Death Meter" tool on its official website. The tool allows users to calculate their probability of death within a certain period based on statistics.
Death is an inevitable truth of life. But what are the odds?
In many countries and cultures, death is a taboo subject, and in the Japanese insurance industry, for example, the word "death" is often replaced with the word "unforeseen circumstance." However, the odds are not always 0.01% (unforeseen circumstance). Habitto believes that it is important for people to know their true "unforeseen circumstance" probability in order to live a fulfilling life, and has developed this tool for that purpose.
With the Death Meter, users can enter their current age and any future age they want to simulate, and see how much their risk of death is during that period, such as "until my daughter who is now in kindergarten graduates from college" or "until I pay off the mortgage on the house I bought this year."
"The name 'Death Meter' may sound a bit scary and sensational, but that's not our intention," said Liam McCance, founder and Chief Creative Officer of Habitto. "This is also not a tactic to scare people into buying insurance. Rather, we want young people to understand this risk correctly as a statistical fact, prepare for it in the most cost-effective and efficient way possible, and use the rest of their money to enjoy their lives today and invest in their future."
Yasunori Kume, COO of Habitto, who also has experience as the president of a life insurance company, said, "Even in the life insurance industry, I have rarely met anyone who understands their own mortality risk. Habitto will continue to introduce unique tools to the world and, together with advisors, support all of your savings, investments, and insurance."
**Note:** Based on the 23rd Life Table released by the Ministry of Health, Labor and Welfare
**  
  
About Habitto**
Habitto is an "advising digital bank" that provides savings, investment, insurance, and advice under the mission of "End Financial Anxiety | ãŠé‡‘ã®ä¸å®‰ã‚’ãªãã™." With the highest deposit interest rate in Japan, debit cashback, and free personalized advice, we support the money strategies of the younger generation.
Habitto was founded by Samantha Giottini, an Italian woman who turned from a venture capitalist to a fintech entrepreneur, and Liam McCance, a serial entrepreneur from Australia. The company was launched as SJ Mobile Lab Japan Co., Ltd. in November 2021 and changed its name to Habitto Co., Ltd. in March 2023.

Habittoã¯ã€ã€ŒEnd Financial Anxiety | ãŠé‡‘ã®ä¸å®‰ã‚’ãªãã™ã€ã¨ã„ã†ãƒ‘ãƒ¼ãƒ‘ã‚¹ã®ã‚‚ã¨ã€è²¯è“„ã€æŠ•è³‡ã€ä¿é™ºã€ãã—ã¦ã‚¢ãƒ‰ãƒã‚¤ã‚¹ã®å…¨ã¦ã‚’æä¾›ã™ã‚‹é‡‘èãƒ—ãƒ©ãƒƒãƒˆãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒ ã€Œã‚¢ãƒ‰ãƒã‚¤ã‚¹ã™ã‚‹ãƒ‡ã‚¸ã‚¿ãƒ«ãƒãƒ³ã‚¯ã€ã§ã™ã€‚å›½å†…æœ€é«˜æ°´æº–ã®é é‡‘é‡‘åˆ©ã€ãƒ‡ãƒ“ãƒƒãƒˆãƒ»ã‚­ãƒ£ãƒƒã‚·ãƒ¥ãƒãƒƒã‚¯ã€ç„¡æ–™ã§ãƒ‘ãƒ¼ã‚½ãƒŠãƒ«ãªã‚¢ãƒ‰ãƒã‚¤ã‚¹ã§è‹¥ã„ä¸–ä»£ã®ãƒãƒãƒ¼æˆ¦ç•¥ã‚’ã‚µãƒãƒ¼ãƒˆã—ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚
Habittoã¯ã€ãƒ™ãƒ³ãƒãƒ£ãƒ¼æŠ•è³‡å®¶ã‹ã‚‰ãƒ•ã‚£ãƒ³ãƒ†ãƒƒã‚¯çµŒå–¶è€…ã¸è»¢èº«ã—ãŸã‚¤ã‚¿ãƒªã‚¢äººå¥³æ€§ã®ã‚µãƒãƒ³ã‚µãƒ»ã‚®ã‚ªãƒƒãƒ†ã‚£ã¨ã€ã‚ªãƒ¼ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ©ãƒªã‚¢å‡ºèº«ã®é€£ç¶šèµ·æ¥­å®¶ãƒªã‚¢ãƒ ãƒ»ãƒã‚«ãƒ³ã‚¹ã«ã‚ˆã£ã¦ç«‹ã¡ä¸Šã’ã‚‰ã‚Œã¾ã—ãŸã€‚2021å¹´11æœˆã«ã‚¨ã‚¹ã‚¸ã‚§ã‚¤ãƒ»ãƒ¢ãƒã‚¤ãƒ«ãƒ©ãƒœã‚¸ãƒ£ãƒ‘ãƒ³æ ªå¼ä¼šç¤¾ã¨ã—ã¦ã‚¹ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒˆã—ã€2023å¹´3æœˆã€ç¤¾åã‚’æ­£å¼ã«æ ªå¼ä¼šç¤¾Habittoã«å¤‰æ›´ã—ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚
  

Habitto, the Japanese digital bank with free financial advice among the younger generation, proudly announces a significant milestone achieved within less than a year of operations. Habitto has surpassed 10,000 registered users, with 5,000 savings accounts successfully opened, collectively amassing over Â¥2 billion in customer deposits.
The Tokyo-based startup has demonstrated tremendous growth in savings deposits since its launch. Within just 7 months of operation, Habitto reached Â¥1 billion in savings deposits. By May 2024, Habitto surpassed Â¥2 billion, adding an additional Â¥1 billion in savings deposits in just under 4 months.
Liam McCance, Co-founder and Chief Creative Officer of Habitto, expressed his excitement about this achievement:
"Habitto's purpose is to end financial anxiety, and this milestone is a great step towards achieving this. These 10,000 customers not only have access to the best savings rate in Japan but also to free financial advice and a team dedicated to helping them create a solid money strategy. Remarkably, approximately 30% of our customers have already actively engaged with our financial advisors, benefiting from personalized guidance and support.
Samantha Ghiotti, Co-founder and Chief Executive Officer of Habitto also articulated her pride in reaching this milestone:
â€œJapanâ€™s younger generation has taken little action in building their money strategy and they feel anxious about it with no one they trust to make important money decisions. We aim to be the brand they turn to, putting their money at work with simple products and genuine financial advice. With this goal in mind, we are building Japanâ€™s first hybrid distribution platform, integrating the power of technology with the empathy of human relationships.â€ 
Overall, this breakthrough underscores Habitto's commitment to providing innovative financial solutions and empowering individuals to build insurance and investment assets to secure their financial future.
**About Habitto Co., Ltd.**
Habitto Co., Ltd. is the operator of â€œHabittoâ€, a digital bank that provides free financial advice via mobile application. The Habitto app offers a combination of financial services including a market-leading yield savings account, debit card, insurance and investment products which are complemented with truly customer-focused advisory service.
The company was born in Singapore when Samantha Ghiotti, an Italian woman turned venture investor turned fintech executive, and Liam McCance, a serial entrepreneur from Australia, worked together in a Singaporean fintech company. The duo then founded SJ Mobile Labs Pte Ltd in Singapore in 2021 and established SJ Mobile Labs Japan KK (SJML Japan) in November of the same year to conduct business in Japan. The company officially changed its name to Habitto Co., Ltd. in March 2023.

### Habitto is launching the Valentine's advertising campaign "Love and Finances with the Right Partner" targeting individuals nationwide.
Published on 2024-02-13
![](https://www.habitto.com/blogs/valentines-day-2024/)![](https://www.habitto.com/blogs/valentines-day-2024/)![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/60186/1709344997-dato-cms-1.png?auto=format)
**æ ªå¼ä¼šç¤¾Habittoã¯ã€2024å¹´2æœˆ14æ—¥ã«ãƒãƒ¬ãƒ³ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒ³ç‰¹åˆ¥ãƒ‡ã‚¸ã‚¿ãƒ«åºƒå‘Šã‚­ãƒ£ãƒ³ãƒšãƒ¼ãƒ³ã€Œæ‹ã‚‚ã€ãŠé‡‘ã‚‚ã€è‰¯ããƒ‘ãƒ¼ãƒˆãƒŠãƒ¼ã¨ã€ã‚’Tinderãªã©ã®ãƒãƒƒãƒãƒ³ã‚°ã‚¢ãƒ—ãƒªã«é…ä¿¡ã—ã¾ã™ã€‚æœ¬åºƒå‘Šã‚’é€šã˜ã¦ã€ã€Œãƒãƒ¬ãƒ³ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒ³ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã«æ‹æ„›ã®ãƒ‘ãƒ¼ãƒˆãƒŠãƒ¼æ¢ã—ã‚’ã—ã¦ã„ã‚‹å…¨å›½ã®çš†ã•ã¾ã«å‘ã‘ã¦ã€æ‹äººæ¢ã—ã‚‚å¤§äº‹ã ã‘ã‚Œã©ã€äººç”Ÿã«ãŠã„ã¦æ‹æ„›ã¨åŒã˜ãã‚‰ã„å¤§åˆ‡ãªè³‡ç”£å½¢æˆã®ãƒ‘ãƒ¼ãƒˆãƒŠãƒ¼ã‚’ã¿ã¤ã‘ã¦ã¿ã¾ã›ã‚“ã‹ï¼Ÿã€ã¨ã„ã†ã€Habittoã‹ã‚‰ã®ææ¡ˆã‚’ãŠå±Šã‘ã—ã¾ã™ã€‚**
  
Habittoã§ã¯ã€2024å¹´3æœˆ31æ—¥ã¾ã§å®Ÿæ–½ä¸­ã®ç‰¹åˆ¥é‡‘åˆ©1.0%ã‚­ãƒ£ãƒ³ãƒšãƒ¼ãƒ³ (ç¨å¼•å‰ãƒ»ä¸Šé™100ä¸‡å††)ã‚„ã€æ–°NISAã‚’ã¯ã˜ã‚ã¨ã™ã‚‹æŠ•è³‡ã«é–¢ã™ã‚‹ç„¡æ–™ã‚¢ãƒ‰ãƒã‚¤ã‚¹ãªã©ã€è‹¥ã„ä¸–ä»£ã®ãŠé‡‘ã®ãƒ—ãƒ©ãƒ³ã‚’ã‚µãƒãƒ¼ãƒˆã™ã‚‹ãŸã‚ã®ã‚µãƒ¼ãƒ“ã‚¹ã‚’é †æ¬¡å±•é–‹ä¸­ã§ã™ã€‚  

CCO (ãƒãƒ¼ãƒ•ãƒ»ã‚¯ãƒªã‚¨ã‚¤ãƒ†ã‚£ãƒ–ãƒ»ã‚ªãƒ•ã‚£ã‚µãƒ¼) ãƒªã‚¢ãƒ ãƒ»ãƒã‚«ãƒ³ã‚¹ã¯ã€ä»Šå›ã®ã‚­ãƒ£ãƒ³ãƒšãƒ¼ãƒ³ã«ã¤ã„ã¦ä»¥ä¸‹ã®ã‚ˆã†ã«è¿°ã¹ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚  
  
ã€Œä»Šã®æ™‚ä»£ã€äººç”Ÿã®ãƒ‘ãƒ¼ãƒˆãƒŠãƒ¼ã‚’è¦‹ã¤ã‘ã‚‹ã®ã¯ç°¡å˜ã§ã¯ã‚ã‚Šã¾ã›ã‚“ã€‚ã§ã‚‚ã€è‡ªåˆ†ã®ãŠé‡‘ã«ã¤ã„ã¦ç›¸è«‡ã§ãã‚‹ãƒ‘ãƒ¼ãƒˆãƒŠãƒ¼ãªã‚‰ç§ãŸã¡ã€HabittoãŒã„ã¾ã™ã€‚ç§ãŸã¡ã¯çš†ã•ã‚“ãŒæŠ±ãˆã‚‹å°†æ¥ã¸ã®ä¸å®‰ã‚„æ°—æŒã¡ã€ä»Šã®æ‚©ã¿ã‚’ã—ã£ã‹ã‚Šã¨èãã€ç†è§£è€…ã¨ãªã‚Šã€ã‚ãªãŸã«ã´ã£ãŸã‚Šã®æœ€åˆã®ä¸€æ­©ã‚’è¸ã¿å‡ºã™ãƒ‘ãƒ¼ãƒˆãƒŠãƒ¼ã¨ã—ã¦ä¸€ç·’ã«æ­©ã‚“ã§ã„ãã¾ã™ã€‚ã€
  

Habitto Co., Ltd. will be launching a special Valentine's digital advertising campaign, titled "Love and Finances with the Right Partner," on dating apps such as Tinder on February 14, 2024. Through this campaign, we aim to convey the message, "While searching for a romantic partner on Valentine's Day is important, have you considered finding a partner for financial planning, equally crucial in life?" to everyone across the country seeking a relationship.
As part of our ongoing efforts to support the financial plans of the younger generation, Habitto is introducing various services, including a special interest rate campaign of 1.0% (pre-tax, with a limit of 1 million yen) until March 31, 2024, and free advice on investments, including the new NISA.
Liam Macans, Chief Creative Officer (CCO), expressed the following about the campaign:
"In today's world, finding a life partner is not easy. However, when it comes to discussing your finances, we at Habitto are here for you. We listen carefully to the concerns, anxieties about the future, and current issues you may have, becoming understanding partners. We are committed to walking with you, providing the perfect first step tailored to you."[   
](https://www.habitto.com/blogs/valentines-day-2024/)

PRæ‹…å½“ï¼š è—¤äº•  
Emailï¼špress@habitto.com
  

Entering 2024, Habitto Co., Ltd. has exceeded a cumulative deposit amount of Â¥1 billion into its savings accounts. In response to the trust received from everyone, Habitto is expanding its advisory services on investments, including the new NISA.
Habitto's mission is to support the younger generation, aged 20-40, in creating their own financial plans and building assets. NISA, which allows for long-term diversified investments with tax advantages, is a system that the younger generation should definitely consider utilizing. Habitto is ready to support those who are looking to start NISA in two ways.
Support for those who want to start NISA on their own but find it challenging to understand:
Through one-on-one video sessions or chat conversations, Habitto advisors will guide you patiently, providing information on considerations such as choosing financial institutions and funds when creating an account. Even for those who have already opened a NISA account with another financial institution, Habitto will offer valuable advice within the legal limits.
Support for those who want professional recommendations:
For those who have not opened a NISA account and are unsure where to start, Habitto confidently introduces selected Sezon Investment Trust funds and assists step by step from account opening to starting NISA.
COO Yasunori Kume, who oversees the advisory team, expresses his thoughts on assisting with the new NISA:
"While there are many financial institutions recommending NISA, Habitto takes pride in providing top-class kindness, thoroughness, and approachability in supporting the younger generation. It doesn't matter if you have opened a NISA account with another company. If you have questions or need support, please don't hesitate to rely on Habitto advisors."

æœ¬ä»¶å•ã„åˆã‚ã›å…ˆ: _press@habitto.com_
  

Habitto (location: Shibuya-ku, Tokyo, founder and CEO: Samantha Ghiotti, hereinafter referred to as Habitto), a digital bank that provides financial advice, has been nominated as the finalists at the 2023 Singapore FinTech Festival (SFF) Global FinTech Awards. 
The award recognizes innovative fintech solutions from companies and individuals who are transforming fintech industry practices and leading the way in leveraging new technologies to create new growth opportunities, promote financial inclusion, and enhance the delivery of financial services. Habitto was selected as one of six finalists out of 72 applications in the corporate category. The winners of this award will be announced at the Singapore Fintech Festival (SFF) Global Fintech Awards Dinner on 16 November 2023.
Comment from Samantha Ghiotti (Founder and CEO):
â€œI am very happy to have been selected as a finalist in the SFF Global FinTech Awards, which is the largest event in the world. We believe this is the great opportunity for many people to come to know and appreciate Habittoâ€™s mission. Being granted this opportunity is a major milestone for us, having just launched our service in June of this year. We will continue to work hard to provide valuable services."  

<About SFF>
Singapore FinTech Festival (SFF) is a global event that brings together the policy, finance and technology communities. SFF is intended to be a platform for exploring the intersection of cutting-edge financial solutions, the evolving regulatory environment, and the latest technological innovations, fostering impactful connections and collaborations.
Through insightful sessions, roundtables, workshops, exhibitions and more, SFF is a place to discover and dialogue about the trajectory of the future of financial services and the comprehensive digital transformation that is reshaping the global economy. Last year we welcomed 62,000 participants from 134 countries. [_https://www.fintechfestival.sg/_](https://www.fintechfestival.sg/)
<About Habitto Co., Ltd.>
The company was founded by Samantha Ghiotti, an Italian woman turned venture investor turned fintech manager, and Liam McCance, an Australian entrepreneur, who met in Singapore. The two established SJ Mobile Labs Pte Ltd in Singapore in 2021, and in November of the same year established SJ Mobile Labs Japan, which operates in Japan, before changing the company name to Habitto Co., Ltd. in March 2023.
Habitto Co., Ltd. proposes new money habits to the younger generation of Japan, with the hope that they will gain financial freedom by growing their money. In order to carry out this business, we became the first foreign company to register as a financial services intermediary business in October 2022. [_https://www.habitto.com/_](https://www.habitto.com/)
For inquiries regarding this matter: press@habitto.com

æ ªå¼ä¼šç¤¾Habittoã¯ã€æ—¥æœ¬ã®è‹¥ã„ä¸–ä»£ã«ã€ŒãŠé‡‘ã‚’è‚²ã¦ã‚‹ã“ã¨ã§çµŒæ¸ˆçš„ãªè‡ªç”±ã‚’ç²å¾—ã—ã¦ã»ã—ã„ã€ã¨ã„ã†æ€ã„ã‹ã‚‰ã€æ–°ã—ã„ãŠé‡‘ã®ç¿’æ…£ã‚’ææ¡ˆã—ã¾ã™ã€‚ã“ã®æ¥­å‹™ã‚’é‚è¡Œã™ã‚‹ãŸã‚ã«ã€2022å¹´10æœˆã«å¤–å›½ç³»ä¼æ¥­ã¨ã—ã¦ã¯åˆã‚ã¦é‡‘èã‚µãƒ¼ãƒ“ã‚¹ä»²ä»‹æ¥­ã®ç™»éŒ²ã‚’è¡Œã„ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚
  
  
æœ¬ä»¶å•ã„åˆã‚ã›å…ˆ: _press@habitto.com_
  

Habitto, a digital bank with free financial advice, wants to send a wake-up call to younger Japanese to awaken their savings and get a money strategy. Habitto sees from the experience with younger Japanese that they have a high level of anxiety when it comes to money yet they struggle to take action steps to develop a money strategy. Our 1% savings account campaign is designed to encourage those sitting on the fence to wake the next and activate their savings
Features of Habitto's special interest rate campaign include
  * Best class interest rate of 1.0%: During the campaign period, an interest rate of 1.0% (before tax) will be applied to account balances at partner GMO Aozora Net Bank's Habitto branch. This should be a great offer for young people to effectively grow their assets.
  * Duration and Terms: The offer period runs from October 1, 2023, through March 31, 2024. The special interest rate of 1.0% will be applied to the account balance during this period for the first 5,000 account holders. The special interest rate of 1.0% will be applied to the first 5,000 account holders, after which the regular interest rate of 0.3% at Habito Branch will be applied.
  * Interest rate cap: The 1.0% interest rate is capped at 1,000,000 yen, and 0.001% will be applied to the amount exceeding 1,000,000 yen.


Through this special interest rate campaign, Habitto is proud to help young people take the first step toward building their future wealth and creating a sound money plan. With this spirit, the campaign is open to individuals between the ages of 18 and 54. It offers the experience of growing your money at the Bank Rate and helps you work on your future financial planning.
For more information on this campaign and how to apply, please visit Habitto's website or feel free to contact us for more information.
Liam McCance, Founder and CCO, comments, 
â€œWhy are we offering the best rate in the market without lock-ins, fees or complicated conditions? Because things are changing, cost of living, inflation and growth have returned to the Japanese market, however, economic indicators usually move faster than human behaviour when it comes to money. We believe the younger generation needs to wake up their savings and start to educate themselves on how to get a money strategy that works for today. Weâ€™re offering the best rate in the market without lock-ins, fees or complicated conditions to wake up the market and get savings to work.â€

Habittoæ–°ã‚ªãƒ•ã‚£ã‚¹ä½æ‰€ï¼šæ±äº¬éƒ½æ¸‹è°·åŒºç¥å®®å‰3-19-7
Habittoæ–°ã‚ªãƒ•ã‚£ã‚¹ã®è¨­è¨ˆã¨æ–½å·¥: Node Design Consultants (https://node-dc.jp/) 
Habittoã‚¢ãƒ—ãƒªã®è©³ç´°ã¯[ _ã“ã¡ã‚‰_](https://habitto-sjml.app.link/EAm0YPnmQxb)ã€‚
  

28th July 2023 - Habitto the digital bank offering a market-leading savings rate of 0.3% launched its app on June 13 2023 has already seen over 12,000 downloads and over Â¥130 million in new deposits. But the brand still believes it needs to do more to make financial products appealing and accessible to the younger generation. With this goal in mind, Habitto has opened its new office in the fashion district of Cat Street Uruhara.
â€˜It might not seem an obvious choice for a financial business to have its office in one of the world's most popular fashion districts but we didnâ€™t just want a workspace for our team but a space that reflected our mission and valuesâ€™ Liam McCance Co-founder & Chief Creative Officer. â€˜This mission is to simplify financial products, make finance more accessible and to be more transparent. So instead of being hidden away in a high-rise office tower in the financial district, we wanted to be closer to our customers in an area where they are spending their hard-earned savings. This office is designed to make our brand accessible to our target audience and remind these potential customers that they can also achieve financial freedom with access to the right products and financial advice.â€™ Liam McCance
â€˜Despite being a mobile-first finance brand, we still believe that itâ€™s essential to connect with customers at ground level and with a human approach. Trust in financial brands is built over time through many positive customer experiences both mobile and face-to-face.â€™ Samantha Ghiotti Co-Founder & CEO
  * Habittoâ€™s new office is located at street level Jingumae, 3âˆ’19âˆ’7, Shibuya Ku, Tokyo, Japan
  * Habittoâ€™s office was designed and fit out by Node Design Consultants [_https://node-dc.jp/_](https://node-dc.jp/)
  * Download Habitto App from [here](https://habitto-sjml.app.link/EAm0YPnmQxb).

### Helping People Take Action With Their Money - A New Kind of Coaching Arrives in Japan
Published on 2025-04-01
![](https://www.habitto.com/blogs/money-mojo/)![](https://www.habitto.com/blogs/money-mojo/)![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/60186/1743499581-money-mojo.jpeg?auto=format)
At Habitto, weâ€™ve always believed that helping people feel better about money goes beyond great products.
In 2024, we teamed up with [_**Money Mojo**_](https://www.linkedin.com/company/money-mojo/?viewAsMember=true), a global financial coaching consultancy, to co-create Japanâ€™s first **money behavioural coaching program**.
Our goal? Help people build the confidence to make smart financial decisions - not just know what to do, but actually _do_ it.
ğŸš€ **What We Built Together** : Led by behavioural finance coach [_Sanam Balani_](https://www.linkedin.com/in/sanambalani/), Money Mojo worked closely with our team to:
  * Design a step-by-step coaching system, tailored to Japanese users
  * Train our in-house advisors in new coaching and behavioural skills
  * Deliver practical support that helped users change their habits


ğŸ“ˆ **The Pilot Results Were Powerful**
  * **334%** increase in monthly app opens
  * **318%** increase in chat and video engagement
  * **100%** of users felt more **confident making financial decisions**
  * **100%** rated the experience **5/5 for value and relevance**
  * Advisors scored **4.75/5 for delivery**


ğŸ§­ **Why It Matters** This isnâ€™t just a new product. Itâ€™s a new way forward. Blending human coaching, fintech, and behavioural insight can create deeper, more lasting change in how people manage money.
ğŸ‘ Big thanks to Sanam and the Money Mojo team for leading this engagement from strategy to delivery.
ğŸ“– [See the full case study](https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/habitto-experiment-how-financial-coaching-led-record-engagement-fzxsf) by Money Mojo for more insights.
* * *
### **About Money Mojo**
[_**Money Mojo**_](https://www.linkedin.com/company/money-mojo/?viewAsMember=true) is a boutique financial wellbeing consultancy helping people gain confidence and take action with their money. Founded by [_**Sanam Balani**_](https://www.linkedin.com/in/sanambalani/), a former Goldman Sachs executive, the firm partners with innovative financial institutions globally to create behavioural coaching programs that build trust and engagement with clients. Sanam brings deep banking expertise across JAPAC and EMEA, with a modern coaching lens focused on behaviour change.
ğŸ”—[ _Connect with Sanam Balani on LinkedIn_](https://www.linkedin.com/in/sanambalani/)
ğŸ”—[ _Book a Consultation with Money Mojo_](https://calendly.com/moneymojo/discovery)

**Scrum Venturesã«ã¤ã„ã¦**
ã‚¹ã‚¯ãƒ©ãƒ ãƒ™ãƒ³ãƒãƒ£ãƒ¼ã‚ºã¯ã€ã‚·ãƒªã‚³ãƒ³ãƒãƒ¬ãƒ¼ã¨æ±äº¬ã‚’æ‹ ç‚¹ã¨ã—ã€ã‚¢ãƒ¼ãƒªãƒ¼ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒ¼ã‚¸ã®ã‚¹ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒˆã‚¢ãƒƒãƒ—æŠ•è³‡ã¨ã€æ—¥æœ¬ä¼æ¥­ã¨ã‚°ãƒ­ãƒ¼ãƒãƒ«ã‚¹ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒˆã‚¢ãƒƒãƒ—ã®æ–°è¦äº‹æ¥­å‰µå‡ºã‚’è¡Œã£ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚ã‚ªãƒ¼ãƒ—ãƒ³ã‚¤ãƒãƒ™ãƒ¼ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ã®æ‰‹æ³•ã‚’æ´»ç”¨ã—ã€å„æ¥­ç•Œã‚’ä»£è¡¨ã™ã‚‹ãƒ‘ãƒ¼ãƒˆãƒŠãƒ¼ã¨ã‚¹ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒˆã‚¢ãƒƒãƒ—ã¨ã®å…±å‰µã‚’æ”¯æ´ã™ã‚‹ã€Œäº‹æ¥­å…±å‰µãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚°ãƒ©ãƒ ã€ã®é‹å–¶ã‚„ã€æµ·å¤–ã‚¹ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒˆã‚¢ãƒƒãƒ—ã®æ—¥æœ¬é€²å‡ºç­‰ã‚’æ”¯æ´ã—ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚
  

**TOKYO â€“ 27th November 2024 â€“**[ _**Habitto**_](https://www.habitto.com/)**, the Japan-based digital bank looking to end financial anxiety for younger Japanese people, has raised US$11.7 million (JPY1.8 billion) via its Series A financing round.**  
  
The digital bank, offering a connected financial experience and free financial advice, via its mobile app, has attracted leading venture firms QED Investors, DG Daiwa Ventures (DGDV) and Scrum Ventures. This marks QED Investors first investment in Japan, following several high-profile investments in similar B2C fintechs, including Nubank in Brazil, Klarna in Sweden and Jupiter in India. Habittoâ€™s Series A round also saw returning investors Anthemis Group and other existing shareholders. 
The Series A funding will enable Habitto to accelerate its mission of reducing financial anxiety among Japan's younger generations, who often face economic uncertainties and lack access to appropriate financial advice. With a rapidly growing user base of over 42,000 installs Habitto's mobile app offers a comprehensive, free financial planning service supported by digital advisors providing personalised guidance to help users build effective financial strategies.
Key highlights of the funding round include:
  * An equity financing round of US$11.7 million (JPY1.8 billion)
  * Funds will be used to expand Habitto's user base under attractive unit economics, enhance its digital banking platform, and develop advanced financial tools and services tailored to the unique needs of young Japanese consumers.


Samantha Ghiotti, Co-founder & CEO, said, â€œWeâ€™re fortunate to have the support of a globally experienced investor like QED, paired with the local expertise of DGDV. Itâ€™s certainly a challenging funding environment, but in these two investors, weâ€™ve found partners with deep experience and knowledge in fintech. Habitto saw strong interest in the Japanese market from global investors throughout this round and we're excited for those making their way into the market for the first time.â€
In September 2021, Habitto initially raised a US$3.4 million seed round led by Saison Capital followed by a US$3.9 million pre-A financing round in February 2023, co-led by Saison Capital and Cherubic Ventures. With the recent completion of this US$11.7 million Series A round, Habittoâ€™s total capital raised now stands at US$19 million.
â€œWith this financing and backing of these investors, we will continue to tackle financial anxiety by helping Japanâ€™s younger generation develop money strategies. In just three years since our launch Habitto has been entrusted with more than JPY4.7 billion in deposits from customers looking to build a money strategy and better money habitsâ€ said Liam McCance, Co-founder & Chief Creative Officer.
â€œWe are enthusiastic about partnering with Habitto. Japan's fintech market is primed for innovation, with recent economic shifts drawing investor attention. Sam and Liam and the experienced team at Habitto have shown early success, securing key partnerships and licenses and are well set to build a compelling proposition for the market. This is our first investment in Japan and we are thrilled to be a part of the community,â€ commented Sandeep Patil, Partner & Head of Asia at QED Investors.
"We have been partnering with Habitto since 2021 and have been consistently impressed by the remarkable progress and performance under Sam and Liam's leadership. For this Series A round we are excited to co-lead alongside QED, a globally renowned fintech VC. With the involvement of a globally renowned firm in their Series A round, we not only reaffirm our strong belief in Habittoâ€™s massive potential but also in its ability to create a positive impact on Japan's fintech ecosystem" commented Yamato Watanabe, Managing Director at DG Daiwa Ventures, who is co-leading this round.
â€œWe are happy to support Sam, Liam and the whole team at Habitto againâ€, said Sean Park, co-founder of Anthemis Group, who will be joining the board as an observer as part of the round. â€œHaving been a part of the companyâ€™s journey from the very start, we are confident in the teamâ€™s ability to execute in this largely untapped market. Anthemis believes authentic collaboration is the key to success in finance, and the product experience Habitto has been able to create is a shining example of that.â€
**About Habitto Co., Ltd.**
Habitto Co., Ltd. is the operator of â€œHabittoâ€, a digital bank that provides free financial advice via mobile application. The Habitto app offers a combination of financial services including a market-leading yield savings account, debit card, insurance and investment products which are complemented with a tech-delivered human advisory service.
The company was born in Singapore when Samantha Ghiotti, an Italian woman turned venture investor turned fintech executive and Liam McCance, an entrepreneur from Australia, worked together in a Singaporean fintech company. The duo then founded SJ Mobile Labs Pte Ltd in Singapore in 2021 and established SJ Mobile Labs Japan KK (SJML Japan) in November of the same year to conduct business in Japan. The company officially changed its name to Habitto Co., Ltd. in March 2023.
**About QED Investors**
QED Investors is a global leading venture capital firm based in Alexandria, VA. Founded by Nigel Morris and Frank Rotman in 2007, QED Investors is focused on investing in disruptive financial services companies worldwide. QED Investors is dedicated to building great businesses and uses a unique, hands-on approach that leverages its partnersâ€™ decades of entrepreneurial and operational experience, helping companies achieve breakthrough growth. Notable investments include AvidXchange, Betterfly, Bitso, Caribou, ClearScore, Creditas, Credit Karma, Current, Flywire, Kavak, Klarna, Konfio, Loft, Mission Lane, Nubank, QuintoAndar, Remitly, SoFi, Wagestream and Wayflyer.
**About DG Daiwa Ventures**
DG Daiwa Ventures (DGDV) is a Tokyo-based venture capital firm that specialises in seed and early-stage investments, with a strong emphasis on global innovation. While headquartered in Japan, the firm maintains a diverse portfolio, with half of its investments in international companies. DGDV is dedicated to fostering cutting-edge technologies, while actively expanding into emerging fields such as deep tech, fintech and climate tech. The firmâ€™s mission is to drive transformative change across industries by bridging the gap between Japan and the world and by investing in startups that are pushing the boundaries of innovation.
**About Anthemis Group**
Anthemis Group cultivates change in the financial system by investing in, growing and sustaining businesses committed to resiliency, transparency, access and equity. Founded on three guiding principles - authentic collaboration, virtuous cycle outcomes and diversity and inclusivity - their deep understanding of markets and models, passion for emerging technology and values inspire everything they do. By creating fertile ground for a diverse group of startups, investors, entrepreneurs, institutions, academics, and visionaries to converge, they can solve the financial system's most pressing challenges faster, better and for the benefit of all.
**About Scrum Ventures**
Scrum Ventures, with offices in San Francisco and Tokyo, is committed to investing in industry-changing startups. Our team brings entrepreneurial experience and deep networks in both Silicon Valley and Asia, actively supporting founders throughout their journeys. Through Scrum Studio, we accelerate the growth of our portfolio companies by facilitating access to the Japanese market and fostering partnerships with iconic corporations.

For general media enquiries, please contact:  
Liam McCance media@habitto.com

###

æ—¥æœ¬ã§ã¯é•·ã‚‰ãã‚¼ãƒ­é‡‘åˆ©æ™‚ä»£ãŒç¶šãã€è‹¥ã„ä¸–ä»£ã§ã¯é‡‘åˆ©ã®å­˜åœ¨ã‚’å¿˜ã‚Œã¦ã—ã¾ã£ãŸäººã‚‚å¤šãã„ã¾ã™ã€‚ãã‚“ãªä¸­ã€GMOã‚ãŠãã‚‰ãƒãƒƒãƒˆéŠ€è¡Œã®æ™®é€šé é‡‘å£åº§ã«èˆˆå‘³ã‚’æŒã¤ãŠå®¢ã•ã¾ã¯ã€ãƒãƒƒãƒˆéŠ€è¡Œã®åˆ©ä¾¿æ€§ã‚„ã‚³ã‚¹ãƒˆã®ä½ã•ã«åˆ©ç‚¹ã‚’è¦‹å‡ºã—ãŸã‚¹ãƒãƒ¼ãƒˆãªäººãŸã¡ã§ã™ã€‚Habittoã§ã¯ã“ã®äººãŸã¡ã«ã€ä¸ŠãŒã‚Šå§‹ã‚ãŸé‡‘åˆ©ã®é‡è¦æ€§ã«ã‚‚æ°—ã¥ã„ã¦ã‚‚ã‚‰ã„ã€ãƒãƒ¼ãƒªã‚¹ã‚¯ã®æ™®é€šé é‡‘å£åº§ã§ã‚‚ãŠé‡‘ã‚’åƒã‹ã›ã¦ã‚‚ã‚‰ã„ãŸã„ã¨è€ƒãˆã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚è³‡ç”£å½¢æˆã®3ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒƒãƒ—ã¯ã€Œè²¯ã‚ã‚‹ã€ã€Œå¢—ã‚„ã™ã€ã€Œãƒªã‚¹ã‚¯ã«å‚™ãˆã‚‹ã€ã§ã™ã€‚ä»Šå›ã®ææºå¼·åŒ–ã¯ã€æœ€åˆã®ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒƒãƒ—ã§ã‚ã‚‹ã€Œè²¯è“„ã€ã‚’ã™ã§ã«å§‹ã‚ã¦ã„ã‚‹ãƒ»å§‹ã‚ã‚ˆã†ã¨ã—ã¦ã„ã‚‹ãŠå®¢ã•ã¾ãŸã¡ã«ã€æ¬¡ã®ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒƒãƒ—ã«é€²ã‚“ã§ã‚ˆã‚Šå¤§å±€çš„ã«äººç”Ÿã‚’ä¿¯ç°ã—ãŸè³‡ç”£å½¢æˆãƒ—ãƒ©ãƒ³ã‚’æŒã¤ãŠæ‰‹ä¼ã„ã‚’ã™ã‚‹ã¨ã„ã†ã€Habittoã®ã‚µãƒ¼ãƒ“ã‚¹ã‚’çŸ¥ã£ã¦ã„ãŸã ãç´ æ™´ã‚‰ã—ã„æ©Ÿä¼šã¨ãªã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚

ã€ŒHabittoç«‹ã¡ä¸Šã’ã®éš›ã€ç§ãŸã¡ã®ãƒ€ã‚¤ãƒŠãƒŸãƒƒã‚¯ãªãƒ“ã‚¸ãƒã‚¹ã«æœ€é©ãªãƒ‘ãƒ¼ãƒˆãƒŠãƒ¼ã§ã‚ã‚‹ã¨åˆ¤æ–­ã—ã¦é¸ã‚“ã ã®ãŒã€å›½å†…æœ€é«˜ã®BaaSæä¾›è€…ã¨ç§ãŸã¡ãŒæ„Ÿã˜ãŸGMOã‚ãŠãã‚‰ãƒãƒƒãƒˆéŠ€è¡Œã§ã™ã€‚ææºä»¥æ¥Habittoã‚’ã‚µãƒãƒ¼ãƒˆã—ã¦ãã‚Œã¦ã„ã‚‹ã€é‡‘å­ä¼šé•·ã¨ãã®ãƒãƒ¼ãƒ ã¨ã®é–¢ä¿‚ã‚’ã•ã‚‰ã«æ·±ã‚ã€GMOã‚ãŠãã‚‰ãƒãƒƒãƒˆéŠ€è¡Œã®ã‚¨ã‚³ã‚·ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒ å†…ã§Habittoã®ãƒ—ãƒ­ãƒ€ã‚¯ãƒˆã‚’æä¾›ã§ãã‚‹ã“ã¨ã‚’å¤§å¤‰ã†ã‚Œã—ãæ€ã£ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚ã€  
  

Habittoã¯ä»Šå¾Œã‚‚è‹¥ã„ä¸–ä»£ã®ãŠé‡‘ã®ä¸å®‰ã‚’ãªãã™ã¹ãã€ãƒ—ãƒ­ãƒ€ã‚¯ãƒˆã‚„ã‚µãƒ¼ãƒ“ã‚¹é–‹ç™ºã«é‚é€²ã—ã¦ã„ãã¾ã™ã€‚  
  
  
ãƒ—ãƒ¬ã‚¹ãƒªãƒªãƒ¼ã‚¹ã¯ã“ã¡ã‚‰ã§ã™ğŸ‘‡  
<https://prtimes.jp/main/html/rd/p/000000028.000093571.html>
  

Habitto, driven by its purpose of "End Financial Anxiety," supports Japan's younger generations in developing asset-building strategies and cultivating good financial habits. Habitto carefully selects from the countless financial products available, making them simple and easy to understand, while providing personalized advice.  
  

We are pleased to announce that Habitto and GMO Aozora Net Bank have entered into a business partnership agreement to display Habitto's advertisements on GMO Aozora Net Bank's website. From August 21, 2024, a special page on the Habitto website will be displayed, allowing users to seamlessly open a Habitto account (GMO Aozora Net Bank Habitto branch) via the advertisement banners posted on GMO Aozora Net Bank's website. This strengthened partnership aims to help more customers discover and utilize Habitto's unique high-interest rates and services that support comprehensive asset-building plans, offering a broader perspective beyond simple savings accounts.  
  

**About Habitto's Offerings**
Habitto targets the younger generation*1, providing a one-stop solution on its app for financial products from trusted domestic partners and personalized advice from dedicated advisors tailored to each user's situation. Utilizing the advisory service is entirely optional, and there is no hard sell of financial products.
  * Savings Account "GMO Aozora Net Bank Habitto Branch" with a BaaS partnership with GMO Aozora Net Bank, offering a domestic top-tier interest rate of 0.3% (up to 1 million JPY, pre-tax)*2
  * A curated selection of investment trusts and insurance products from partner firms*3
  * Personalized asset-building advice from certified financial planners (FPs)


*1 Habitto's services are targeted at individuals aged 18 to 54.  
*2 According to a Habitto survey on July 17, 2024. Note that from October 1, 2024, the interest rate will be 0.4% (up to 1 million JPY, pre-tax).  
*3 Investment products are provided in partnership with Saison Asset Management, and insurance products in partnership with Lifenet Insurance.  
  

**A Long-Term Asset-Building Strategy for Those Who Have Awakened to Interest Rates**
Japan has experienced a prolonged period of near-zero interest rates, causing many in the younger generation to forget the concept of interest rates. In this context, customers interested in GMO Aozora Net Bank's ordinary savings accounts are smart individuals who recognize the advantages of online banking, such as convenience and low costs. Habitto aims to make these individuals aware of the growing importance of rising interest rates and encourages them to make their money work for them, even in a no-risk ordinary savings account. The three steps of asset-building are "Save," "Grow," and "Prepare for Risks." This strengthened partnership presents an excellent opportunity to introduce Habitto's services to customers who have already begun, or are about to begin, the first step of "saving" and help them move on to the next step, adopting a more comprehensive asset-building plan that offers a broader life perspective.  
  

**Comment from CEO Sam Ghiotti on Strengthening the Partnership**
Regarding the enhanced partnership, CEO Sam Ghiotti commented:
"When launching Habitto, we chose GMO Aozora Net Bank, which we felt was the best BaaS provider in the country, as the ideal partner for our dynamic business. We are delighted to further deepen our relationship with Chairman Kaneko and his team, who have supported Habitto since our partnership began, and to be able to offer Habitto's products within the GMO Aozora Net Bank ecosystem."  
  

Habitto will continue to focus on product and service development to alleviate financial anxiety among the younger generations.

æ³¨ï¼š*åšç”ŸåŠ´åƒçœç™ºè¡¨ã®ç¬¬23å›ç”Ÿå‘½è¡¨ã«åŸºã¥ã„ã¦ã„ã¾ã™  

**Habittoã«ã¤ã„ã¦**
Habittoã¯ã€ã€ŒEnd Financial Anxiety | ãŠé‡‘ã®ä¸å®‰ã‚’ãªãã™ã€ã¨ã„ã†ãƒ‘ãƒ¼ãƒ‘ã‚¹ã®ã‚‚ã¨ã€è²¯è“„ã€æŠ•è³‡ã€ä¿é™ºã€ãã—ã¦ã‚¢ãƒ‰ãƒã‚¤ã‚¹ã®å…¨ã¦ã‚’æä¾›ã™ã‚‹ã€Œã‚¢ãƒ‰ãƒã‚¤ã‚¹ã™ã‚‹ãƒ‡ã‚¸ã‚¿ãƒ«ãƒãƒ³ã‚¯ã€ã§ã™ã€‚å›½å†…æœ€é«˜æ°´æº–ã®é é‡‘é‡‘åˆ©ã€ãƒ‡ãƒ“ãƒƒãƒˆãƒ»ã‚­ãƒ£ãƒƒã‚·ãƒ¥ãƒãƒƒã‚¯ã€ç„¡æ–™ã§ãƒ‘ãƒ¼ã‚½ãƒŠãƒ«ãªã‚¢ãƒ‰ãƒã‚¤ã‚¹ã§è‹¥ã„ä¸–ä»£ã®ãƒãƒãƒ¼æˆ¦ç•¥ã‚’ã‚µãƒãƒ¼ãƒˆã—ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚
Habittoã¯ã€ãƒ™ãƒ³ãƒãƒ£ãƒ¼æŠ•è³‡å®¶ã‹ã‚‰ãƒ•ã‚£ãƒ³ãƒ†ãƒƒã‚¯çµŒå–¶è€…ã¸è»¢èº«ã—ãŸã‚¤ã‚¿ãƒªã‚¢äººå¥³æ€§ã®ã‚µãƒãƒ³ã‚µãƒ»ã‚®ã‚ªãƒƒãƒ†ã‚£ã¨ã€ã‚ªãƒ¼ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ©ãƒªã‚¢å‡ºèº«ã®é€£ç¶šèµ·æ¥­å®¶ãƒªã‚¢ãƒ ãƒ»ãƒã‚«ãƒ³ã‚¹ã«ã‚ˆã£ã¦ç«‹ã¡ä¸Šã’ã‚‰ã‚Œã¾ã—ãŸã€‚2021å¹´11æœˆã«ã‚¨ã‚¹ã‚¸ã‚§ã‚¤ãƒ»ãƒ¢ãƒã‚¤ãƒ«ãƒ©ãƒœã‚¸ãƒ£ãƒ‘ãƒ³æ ªå¼ä¼šç¤¾ã¨ã—ã¦ã‚¹ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒˆã—ã€2023å¹´3æœˆã€ç¤¾åã‚’æ ªå¼ä¼šç¤¾Habittoã«å¤‰æ›´ã—ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚
  

**Tokyo, Japan â€“ June 7, 2024** â€“ Habitto, a digital bank that provides savings, investment, insurance, and advice, has launched the "Death Meter" tool on its official website. The tool allows users to calculate their probability of death within a certain period based on statistics.
Death is an inevitable truth of life. But what are the odds?
In many countries and cultures, death is a taboo subject, and in the Japanese insurance industry, for example, the word "death" is often replaced with the word "unforeseen circumstance." However, the odds are not always 0.01% (unforeseen circumstance). Habitto believes that it is important for people to know their true "unforeseen circumstance" probability in order to live a fulfilling life, and has developed this tool for that purpose.
With the Death Meter, users can enter their current age and any future age they want to simulate, and see how much their risk of death is during that period, such as "until my daughter who is now in kindergarten graduates from college" or "until I pay off the mortgage on the house I bought this year."
"The name 'Death Meter' may sound a bit scary and sensational, but that's not our intention," said Liam McCance, founder and Chief Creative Officer of Habitto. "This is also not a tactic to scare people into buying insurance. Rather, we want young people to understand this risk correctly as a statistical fact, prepare for it in the most cost-effective and efficient way possible, and use the rest of their money to enjoy their lives today and invest in their future."
Yasunori Kume, COO of Habitto, who also has experience as the president of a life insurance company, said, "Even in the life insurance industry, I have rarely met anyone who understands their own mortality risk. Habitto will continue to introduce unique tools to the world and, together with advisors, support all of your savings, investments, and insurance."
**Note:** Based on the 23rd Life Table released by the Ministry of Health, Labor and Welfare
**  
  
About Habitto**
Habitto is an "advising digital bank" that provides savings, investment, insurance, and advice under the mission of "End Financial Anxiety | ãŠé‡‘ã®ä¸å®‰ã‚’ãªãã™." With the highest deposit interest rate in Japan, debit cashback, and free personalized advice, we support the money strategies of the younger generation.
Habitto was founded by Samantha Giottini, an Italian woman who turned from a venture capitalist to a fintech entrepreneur, and Liam McCance, a serial entrepreneur from Australia. The company was launched as SJ Mobile Lab Japan Co., Ltd. in November 2021 and changed its name to Habitto Co., Ltd. in March 2023.

CCO (Chief Creative Officer) ãƒªã‚¢ãƒ ãƒ»ãƒã‚«ãƒ³ã‚¹ã¯ã“ã®ãƒã‚¤ãƒ«ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ¼ãƒ³é”æˆã«ã¤ã„ã¦ä»¥ä¸‹ã®ã‚ˆã†ã«è¿°ã¹ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚

**Habittoã«ã¤ã„ã¦**
Habittoã¯ã€ã€ŒEnd Financial Anxiety | ãŠé‡‘ã®ä¸å®‰ã‚’ãªãã™ã€ã¨ã„ã†ãƒ‘ãƒ¼ãƒ‘ã‚¹ã®ã‚‚ã¨ã€è²¯è“„ã€æŠ•è³‡ã€ä¿é™ºã€ãã—ã¦ã‚¢ãƒ‰ãƒã‚¤ã‚¹ã®å…¨ã¦ã‚’æä¾›ã™ã‚‹é‡‘èãƒ—ãƒ©ãƒƒãƒˆãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒ ã€Œã‚¢ãƒ‰ãƒã‚¤ã‚¹ã™ã‚‹ãƒ‡ã‚¸ã‚¿ãƒ«ãƒãƒ³ã‚¯ã€ã§ã™ã€‚å›½å†…æœ€é«˜æ°´æº–ã®é é‡‘é‡‘åˆ©ã€ãƒ‡ãƒ“ãƒƒãƒˆãƒ»ã‚­ãƒ£ãƒƒã‚·ãƒ¥ãƒãƒƒã‚¯ã€ç„¡æ–™ã§ãƒ‘ãƒ¼ã‚½ãƒŠãƒ«ãªã‚¢ãƒ‰ãƒã‚¤ã‚¹ã§è‹¥ã„ä¸–ä»£ã®ãƒãƒãƒ¼æˆ¦ç•¥ã‚’ã‚µãƒãƒ¼ãƒˆã—ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚
Habittoã¯ã€ãƒ™ãƒ³ãƒãƒ£ãƒ¼æŠ•è³‡å®¶ã‹ã‚‰ãƒ•ã‚£ãƒ³ãƒ†ãƒƒã‚¯çµŒå–¶è€…ã¸è»¢èº«ã—ãŸã‚¤ã‚¿ãƒªã‚¢äººå¥³æ€§ã®ã‚µãƒãƒ³ã‚µãƒ»ã‚®ã‚ªãƒƒãƒ†ã‚£ã¨ã€ã‚ªãƒ¼ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ©ãƒªã‚¢å‡ºèº«ã®é€£ç¶šèµ·æ¥­å®¶ãƒªã‚¢ãƒ ãƒ»ãƒã‚«ãƒ³ã‚¹ã«ã‚ˆã£ã¦ç«‹ã¡ä¸Šã’ã‚‰ã‚Œã¾ã—ãŸã€‚2021å¹´11æœˆã«ã‚¨ã‚¹ã‚¸ã‚§ã‚¤ãƒ»ãƒ¢ãƒã‚¤ãƒ«ãƒ©ãƒœã‚¸ãƒ£ãƒ‘ãƒ³æ ªå¼ä¼šç¤¾ã¨ã—ã¦ã‚¹ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒˆã—ã€2023å¹´3æœˆã€ç¤¾åã‚’æ­£å¼ã«æ ªå¼ä¼šç¤¾Habittoã«å¤‰æ›´ã—ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚
  

Habitto, the Japanese digital bank with free financial advice among the younger generation, proudly announces a significant milestone achieved within less than a year of operations. Habitto has surpassed 10,000 registered users, with 5,000 savings accounts successfully opened, collectively amassing over Â¥2 billion in customer deposits.
The Tokyo-based startup has demonstrated tremendous growth in savings deposits since its launch. Within just 7 months of operation, Habitto reached Â¥1 billion in savings deposits. By May 2024, Habitto surpassed Â¥2 billion, adding an additional Â¥1 billion in savings deposits in just under 4 months.
Liam McCance, Co-founder and Chief Creative Officer of Habitto, expressed his excitement about this achievement:
"Habitto's purpose is to end financial anxiety, and this milestone is a great step towards achieving this. These 10,000 customers not only have access to the best savings rate in Japan but also to free financial advice and a team dedicated to helping them create a solid money strategy. Remarkably, approximately 30% of our customers have already actively engaged with our financial advisors, benefiting from personalized guidance and support.
Samantha Ghiotti, Co-founder and Chief Executive Officer of Habitto also articulated her pride in reaching this milestone:
â€œJapanâ€™s younger generation has taken little action in building their money strategy and they feel anxious about it with no one they trust to make important money decisions. We aim to be the brand they turn to, putting their money at work with simple products and genuine financial advice. With this goal in mind, we are building Japanâ€™s first hybrid distribution platform, integrating the power of technology with the empathy of human relationships.â€ 
Overall, this breakthrough underscores Habitto's commitment to providing innovative financial solutions and empowering individuals to build insurance and investment assets to secure their financial future.
**About Habitto Co., Ltd.**
Habitto Co., Ltd. is the operator of â€œHabittoâ€, a digital bank that provides free financial advice via mobile application. The Habitto app offers a combination of financial services including a market-leading yield savings account, debit card, insurance and investment products which are complemented with truly customer-focused advisory service.
The company was born in Singapore when Samantha Ghiotti, an Italian woman turned venture investor turned fintech executive, and Liam McCance, a serial entrepreneur from Australia, worked together in a Singaporean fintech company. The duo then founded SJ Mobile Labs Pte Ltd in Singapore in 2021 and established SJ Mobile Labs Japan KK (SJML Japan) in November of the same year to conduct business in Japan. The company officially changed its name to Habitto Co., Ltd. in March 2023.

Habittoã§ã¯ã€2024å¹´3æœˆ31æ—¥ã¾ã§å®Ÿæ–½ä¸­ã®ç‰¹åˆ¥é‡‘åˆ©1.0%ã‚­ãƒ£ãƒ³ãƒšãƒ¼ãƒ³ (ç¨å¼•å‰ãƒ»ä¸Šé™100ä¸‡å††)ã‚„ã€æ–°NISAã‚’ã¯ã˜ã‚ã¨ã™ã‚‹æŠ•è³‡ã«é–¢ã™ã‚‹ç„¡æ–™ã‚¢ãƒ‰ãƒã‚¤ã‚¹ãªã©ã€è‹¥ã„ä¸–ä»£ã®ãŠé‡‘ã®ãƒ—ãƒ©ãƒ³ã‚’ã‚µãƒãƒ¼ãƒˆã™ã‚‹ãŸã‚ã®ã‚µãƒ¼ãƒ“ã‚¹ã‚’é †æ¬¡å±•é–‹ä¸­ã§ã™ã€‚  

CCO (ãƒãƒ¼ãƒ•ãƒ»ã‚¯ãƒªã‚¨ã‚¤ãƒ†ã‚£ãƒ–ãƒ»ã‚ªãƒ•ã‚£ã‚µãƒ¼) ãƒªã‚¢ãƒ ãƒ»ãƒã‚«ãƒ³ã‚¹ã¯ã€ä»Šå›ã®ã‚­ãƒ£ãƒ³ãƒšãƒ¼ãƒ³ã«ã¤ã„ã¦ä»¥ä¸‹ã®ã‚ˆã†ã«è¿°ã¹ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚  
  
ã€Œä»Šã®æ™‚ä»£ã€äººç”Ÿã®ãƒ‘ãƒ¼ãƒˆãƒŠãƒ¼ã‚’è¦‹ã¤ã‘ã‚‹ã®ã¯ç°¡å˜ã§ã¯ã‚ã‚Šã¾ã›ã‚“ã€‚ã§ã‚‚ã€è‡ªåˆ†ã®ãŠé‡‘ã«ã¤ã„ã¦ç›¸è«‡ã§ãã‚‹ãƒ‘ãƒ¼ãƒˆãƒŠãƒ¼ãªã‚‰ç§ãŸã¡ã€HabittoãŒã„ã¾ã™ã€‚ç§ãŸã¡ã¯çš†ã•ã‚“ãŒæŠ±ãˆã‚‹å°†æ¥ã¸ã®ä¸å®‰ã‚„æ°—æŒã¡ã€ä»Šã®æ‚©ã¿ã‚’ã—ã£ã‹ã‚Šã¨èãã€ç†è§£è€…ã¨ãªã‚Šã€ã‚ãªãŸã«ã´ã£ãŸã‚Šã®æœ€åˆã®ä¸€æ­©ã‚’è¸ã¿å‡ºã™ãƒ‘ãƒ¼ãƒˆãƒŠãƒ¼ã¨ã—ã¦ä¸€ç·’ã«æ­©ã‚“ã§ã„ãã¾ã™ã€‚ã€
  

Habitto Co., Ltd. will be launching a special Valentine's digital advertising campaign, titled "Love and Finances with the Right Partner," on dating apps such as Tinder on February 14, 2024. Through this campaign, we aim to convey the message, "While searching for a romantic partner on Valentine's Day is important, have you considered finding a partner for financial planning, equally crucial in life?" to everyone across the country seeking a relationship.
As part of our ongoing efforts to support the financial plans of the younger generation, Habitto is introducing various services, including a special interest rate campaign of 1.0% (pre-tax, with a limit of 1 million yen) until March 31, 2024, and free advice on investments, including the new NISA.
Liam Macans, Chief Creative Officer (CCO), expressed the following about the campaign:
"In today's world, finding a life partner is not easy. However, when it comes to discussing your finances, we at Habitto are here for you. We listen carefully to the concerns, anxieties about the future, and current issues you may have, becoming understanding partners. We are committed to walking with you, providing the perfect first step tailored to you."[

### Habitto Surpasses Â¥1 Billion in Customer Deposits in Just 7 Months Since Launch and Supports the Younger Generation in Starting New NISA with Free Advice in 2024!

PRæ‹…å½“ï¼š è—¤äº•  
Emailï¼špress@habitto.com
  

Entering 2024, Habitto Co., Ltd. has exceeded a cumulative deposit amount of Â¥1 billion into its savings accounts. In response to the trust received from everyone, Habitto is expanding its advisory services on investments, including the new NISA.
Habitto's mission is to support the younger generation, aged 20-40, in creating their own financial plans and building assets. NISA, which allows for long-term diversified investments with tax advantages, is a system that the younger generation should definitely consider utilizing. Habitto is ready to support those who are looking to start NISA in two ways.
Support for those who want to start NISA on their own but find it challenging to understand:
Through one-on-one video sessions or chat conversations, Habitto advisors will guide you patiently, providing information on considerations such as choosing financial institutions and funds when creating an account. Even for those who have already opened a NISA account with another financial institution, Habitto will offer valuable advice within the legal limits.
Support for those who want professional recommendations:
For those who have not opened a NISA account and are unsure where to start, Habitto confidently introduces selected Sezon Investment Trust funds and assists step by step from account opening to starting NISA.
COO Yasunori Kume, who oversees the advisory team, expresses his thoughts on assisting with the new NISA:
"While there are many financial institutions recommending NISA, Habitto takes pride in providing top-class kindness, thoroughness, and approachability in supporting the younger generation. It doesn't matter if you have opened a NISA account with another company. If you have questions or need support, please don't hesitate to rely on Habitto advisors."

æœ¬ä»¶å•ã„åˆã‚ã›å…ˆ: _press@habitto.com_
  

Habitto (location: Shibuya-ku, Tokyo, founder and CEO: Samantha Ghiotti, hereinafter referred to as Habitto), a digital bank that provides financial advice, has been nominated as the finalists at the 2023 Singapore FinTech Festival (SFF) Global FinTech Awards. 
The award recognizes innovative fintech solutions from companies and individuals who are transforming fintech industry practices and leading the way in leveraging new technologies to create new growth opportunities, promote financial inclusion, and enhance the delivery of financial services. Habitto was selected as one of six finalists out of 72 applications in the corporate category. The winners of this award will be announced at the Singapore Fintech Festival (SFF) Global Fintech Awards Dinner on 16 November 2023.
Comment from Samantha Ghiotti (Founder and CEO):
â€œI am very happy to have been selected as a finalist in the SFF Global FinTech Awards, which is the largest event in the world. We believe this is the great opportunity for many people to come to know and appreciate Habittoâ€™s mission. Being granted this opportunity is a major milestone for us, having just launched our service in June of this year. We will continue to work hard to provide valuable services."  

<About SFF>
Singapore FinTech Festival (SFF) is a global event that brings together the policy, finance and technology communities. SFF is intended to be a platform for exploring the intersection of cutting-edge financial solutions, the evolving regulatory environment, and the latest technological innovations, fostering impactful connections and collaborations.
Through insightful sessions, roundtables, workshops, exhibitions and more, SFF is a place to discover and dialogue about the trajectory of the future of financial services and the comprehensive digital transformation that is reshaping the global economy. Last year we welcomed 62,000 participants from 134 countries. [_https://www.fintechfestival.sg/_](https://www.fintechfestival.sg/)
<About Habitto Co., Ltd.>
The company was founded by Samantha Ghiotti, an Italian woman turned venture investor turned fintech manager, and Liam McCance, an Australian entrepreneur, who met in Singapore. The two established SJ Mobile Labs Pte Ltd in Singapore in 2021, and in November of the same year established SJ Mobile Labs Japan, which operates in Japan, before changing the company name to Habitto Co., Ltd. in March 2023.
Habitto Co., Ltd. proposes new money habits to the younger generation of Japan, with the hope that they will gain financial freedom by growing their money. In order to carry out this business, we became the first foreign company to register as a financial services intermediary business in October 2022. [_https://www.habitto.com/_](https://www.habitto.com/)
For inquiries regarding this matter: press@habitto.com

<æ ªå¼ä¼šç¤¾Habittoã«ã¤ã„ã¦ï¼
ãƒ™ãƒ³ãƒãƒ£ãƒ¼æŠ•è³‡å®¶ã‹ã‚‰ãƒ•ã‚£ãƒ³ãƒ†ãƒƒã‚¯çµŒå–¶è€…ã«è»¢ã˜ãŸã‚¤ã‚¿ãƒªã‚¢äººå¥³æ€§ã‚µãƒãƒ³ã‚µãƒ»ã‚®ã‚ªãƒƒãƒ†ã‚£ã¨ã€ã‚ªãƒ¼ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ©ãƒªã‚¢å‡ºèº«ã®èµ·æ¥­å®¶ãƒªã‚¢ãƒ ãƒ»ãƒã‚«ãƒ³ã‚¹ãŒã€ã‚·ãƒ³ã‚¬ãƒãƒ¼ãƒ«ã§å‡ºä¼šã„ã€å‰µè¨­ã—ãŸä¼šç¤¾ã§ã™ã€‚äºŒäººã¯2021å¹´ã«ã‚·ãƒ³ã‚¬ãƒãƒ¼ãƒ«ã§SJ Mobile Labs Pte Ltd ã‚’è¨­ç«‹ã€åŒå¹´11æœˆã«æ—¥æœ¬ã§äº‹æ¥­ã‚’è¡Œã†ã‚¨ã‚¹ã‚¸ã‚§ã‚¤ãƒ»ãƒ¢ãƒã‚¤ãƒ«ãƒ©ãƒœã‚¸ãƒ£ãƒ‘ãƒ³ã‚’è¨­ç«‹å¾Œã€2023å¹´3æœˆã«æ ªå¼ä¼šç¤¾Habittoã¸ç¤¾åå¤‰æ›´ã—ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚
æ ªå¼ä¼šç¤¾Habittoã¯ã€æ—¥æœ¬ã®è‹¥ã„ä¸–ä»£ã«ã€ŒãŠé‡‘ã‚’è‚²ã¦ã‚‹ã“ã¨ã§çµŒæ¸ˆçš„ãªè‡ªç”±ã‚’ç²å¾—ã—ã¦ã»ã—ã„ã€ã¨ã„ã†æ€ã„ã‹ã‚‰ã€æ–°ã—ã„ãŠé‡‘ã®ç¿’æ…£ã‚’ææ¡ˆã—ã¾ã™ã€‚ã“ã®æ¥­å‹™ã‚’é‚è¡Œã™ã‚‹ãŸã‚ã«ã€2022å¹´10æœˆã«å¤–å›½ç³»ä¼æ¥­ã¨ã—ã¦ã¯åˆã‚ã¦é‡‘èã‚µãƒ¼ãƒ“ã‚¹ä»²ä»‹æ¥­ã®ç™»éŒ²ã‚’è¡Œã„ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚
  
  
æœ¬ä»¶å•ã„åˆã‚ã›å…ˆ: _press@habitto.com_
  

Habitto, a digital bank with free financial advice, wants to send a wake-up call to younger Japanese to awaken their savings and get a money strategy. Habitto sees from the experience with younger Japanese that they have a high level of anxiety when it comes to money yet they struggle to take action steps to develop a money strategy. Our 1% savings account campaign is designed to encourage those sitting on the fence to wake the next and activate their savings
Features of Habitto's special interest rate campaign include
  * Best class interest rate of 1.0%: During the campaign period, an interest rate of 1.0% (before tax) will be applied to account balances at partner GMO Aozora Net Bank's Habitto branch. This should be a great offer for young people to effectively grow their assets.
  * Duration and Terms: The offer period runs from October 1, 2023, through March 31, 2024. The special interest rate of 1.0% will be applied to the account balance during this period for the first 5,000 account holders. The special interest rate of 1.0% will be applied to the first 5,000 account holders, after which the regular interest rate of 0.3% at Habito Branch will be applied.
  * Interest rate cap: The 1.0% interest rate is capped at 1,000,000 yen, and 0.001% will be applied to the amount exceeding 1,000,000 yen.


Through this special interest rate campaign, Habitto is proud to help young people take the first step toward building their future wealth and creating a sound money plan. With this spirit, the campaign is open to individuals between the ages of 18 and 54. It offers the experience of growing your money at the Bank Rate and helps you work on your future financial planning.
For more information on this campaign and how to apply, please visit Habitto's website or feel free to contact us for more information.
Liam McCance, Founder and CCO, comments, 
â€œWhy are we offering the best rate in the market without lock-ins, fees or complicated conditions? Because things are changing, cost of living, inflation and growth have returned to the Japanese market, however, economic indicators usually move faster than human behaviour when it comes to money. We believe the younger generation needs to wake up their savings and start to educate themselves on how to get a money strategy that works for today. Weâ€™re offering the best rate in the market without lock-ins, fees or complicated conditions to wake up the market and get savings to work.â€
  
Contact: _press@habitto.com_

Habittoæ–°ã‚ªãƒ•ã‚£ã‚¹ä½æ‰€ï¼šæ±äº¬éƒ½æ¸‹è°·åŒºç¥å®®å‰3-19-7
Habittoæ–°ã‚ªãƒ•ã‚£ã‚¹ã®è¨­è¨ˆã¨æ–½å·¥: Node Design Consultants (https://node-dc.jp/) 
Habittoã‚¢ãƒ—ãƒªã®è©³ç´°ã¯[ _ã“ã¡ã‚‰_](https://habitto-sjml.app.link/EAm0YPnmQxb)ã€‚
  

28th July 2023 - Habitto the digital bank offering a market-leading savings rate of 0.3% launched its app on June 13 2023 has already seen over 12,000 downloads and over Â¥130 million in new deposits. But the brand still believes it needs to do more to make financial products appealing and accessible to the younger generation. With this goal in mind, Habitto has opened its new office in the fashion district of Cat Street Uruhara.
â€˜It might not seem an obvious choice for a financial business to have its office in one of the world's most popular fashion districts but we didnâ€™t just want a workspace for our team but a space that reflected our mission and valuesâ€™ Liam McCance Co-founder & Chief Creative Officer. â€˜This mission is to simplify financial products, make finance more accessible and to be more transparent. So instead of being hidden away in a high-rise office tower in the financial district, we wanted to be closer to our customers in an area where they are spending their hard-earned savings. This office is designed to make our brand accessible to our target audience and remind these potential customers that they can also achieve financial freedom with access to the right products and financial advice.â€™ Liam McCance
â€˜Despite being a mobile-first finance brand, we still believe that itâ€™s essential to connect with customers at ground level and with a human approach. Trust in financial brands is built over time through many positive customer experiences both mobile and face-to-face.â€™ Samantha Ghiotti Co-Founder & CEO
  * Habittoâ€™s new office is located at street level Jingumae, 3âˆ’19âˆ’7, Shibuya Ku, Tokyo, Japan
  * Habittoâ€™s office was designed and fit out by Node Design Consultants [_https://node-dc.jp/_](https://node-dc.jp/)
  * Download Habitto App from [here](https://habitto-sjml.app.link/EAm0YPnmQxb).
